The verdict

A two-thirds majority (67 votes) is required to

convict the president, setting up his removal

from office. Democrats would have to win over

many Republican votes for this to happen.

67 votes needed

If a majority

votes to convict,

then Trump is

removed from office.

If the vote fails,

then Trump stays

in office.

The process ends.
